Description: Fragment of a band in tapestry, applied and sewn to an undyed linen plain weave. Tapestry is framed on each side with a freize of stylised beige interlacing on a red background. The lower part of the band is decorated with stylised floral motifs, three heart-shaped flowers are framed with small stylised flowers that create lozenges and surrounded by semi-heart-shaped flowers, all in red, yellow and beige on a dark blue background. The upper part of the band is decorated with a standing human figure on a red background. The figure wears a multi-coloured tunic (?) in yellow and red, and a red and light blue mantle. The face is surrounded by beige and red motifs (jewellery?) and by green and yellow halo, which may mean the figure is a saint. ALl the edges of the plain weave are cut and ragged. The edges of the tapestry are hemmed and sewn in oversewing in undyed linen (S), the two other edges of the tapestry are ragged. Plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/18), weft-undyed linen (S/14); tapestry on paired threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/9), weft-undyed linen (S/48); weft-yellow, light green, light and dark blue, red and brown wool (S/red is 52)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
